author: Guarcax
title: Re: Nest doorbell won’t charge
text:
Monday
Battery powered doorbell will not charge via usb cable. When plugged in, nothing lights up and home app does not show it charging. I have checked the charging cord and everything is good. Doorbell will not factory reset either. Holding in the reset button in the pin hole does not change any lights or do anything either. Doorbell has 1% battery and will still work if doorbell button is pressed.
20m ago
Hi [@Ngealy](/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/618388)!
Thanks for posting in the community.
I’m sorry for the inconveniences that you’ve been experiencing with your Nest doorbell. I can see that the doorbell is not charging. You have checked the cable, and you have also done the factory reset, but the device is still having the same behavior. No worries, I’m happy to help you find a solution.
Please do one more factory reset to your Nest doorbell following the next steps:
You can also check the next article for further information: Restart or factory reset Nest camera or doorbell.
Tell me how it goes.
Regards,
Daniel.

author: cfeditoren
title: Salute to Marina Staff! but Let'S Fix Healthcare System - Botswana
text:
Africa-Press – Botswana. The recent incident at Princess Marina Hospital has once again highlighted the nation’s healthcare professionals’ tireless dedication and unwavering commitment.
Under extremely challenging circumstances and with dilapidated equipment, the team at the referral hospital, consisting of doctors, nurses, engineers, and healthcare assistants, managed to save a patient’s life during an emergency operation despite a sudden power failure caused by a faulty generator. Their ability to remain calm and focused, immediately switching to ‘lifesaving mode’ ensured that the patient emerged from the ordeal unscathed and is now recovering well, per a press release from the ministry.
Moments like these remind us of the true heroes within our healthcare system. The Marina team and countless other healthcare workers across the country continue to perform miracles every day, often with limited resources and in less-than-ideal conditions. Their dedication to duty is commendable, and they deserve our heartfelt gratitude and recognition.
However, whilst we celebrate these gallant efforts, we must also address the systemic issues plaguing healthcare facilities. The Ministry of Health’s decision to publicly appreciate the Marina team is undoubtedly well-deserved, but it shouldn’t distract us from the underlying problems that necessitate such heroic measures.
Our healthcare system is in dire need of comprehensive reform. Many of our hospitals are in a state of disrepair, with outdated and malfunctioning equipment, inadequate staffing, and insufficient resources. Incidents like the one at Princess Marina Hospital should serve as a wake-up call for the ministry to take immediate and decisive action to address these issues.
It isn’t enough to simply praise our healthcare workers for their resilience and resourcefulness. We must ensure that they are provided with the necessary tools, equipment, and support to perform their duties effectively and safely. The ministry must prioritise the resourcing of hospitals and the maintenance of equipment to prevent such incidents from recurring. Celebrating the heroism of our healthcare professionals should go hand-in-hand with efforts to improve the conditions under which they work.
Whilst we join the Ministry of Health in applauding the incredible efforts of the Marina team and other dedicated healthcare workers across the country, we must also hold the ministry accountable for the state of our healthcare facilities. Let’s channel our admiration into action and advocate for a healthcare system that isn’t only capable of saving lives in emergencies but also equipped to provide consistent, high-quality care to all citizens.
For More News And Analysis About Botswana Follow Africa-Press

author: TNN
title: Temple Priest: Temple priest dies after ingesting goat blood | Coimbatore News - Times of India
text: Erode: A special puja at a temple near Gobichettipalayam here turned tragic on Tuesday after a temple priest suddenly died during the ceremony. The deceased was identified as S Palanisamy, 45, of Kolappalur. Witnesses said when some goats were sacrificed as part of the ceremony, Palanisamy dipped bananas into the fresh blood and consumed it. While he was eating it, he collapsed suddenly. Villagers rushed him to the government hospital in Gobichettipalayam. However, doctors declared that he was brought dead. The body was then sent for a postmortem. Police have registered a case and are investigating.We also published the following articles recentlyVFX works for Vijay's GOAT completedThalapathy Vijay's film 'The Greatest of All Time' directed by Venkat Prabhu is set to release on September 5, 2024, using a de-aging technique for Vijay's younger portions, with VFX work completed by Lola Visual Effects.110225069Horse and Goat Compatibility: Finding Common Ground in RomanceThe Chinese zodiac and astrology play a significant role in romantic relationships, influencing personalities, compatibility, and areas of life. author: Megan Lampinen
title: Formula E spurs Shell advances in fluid recycling
text:
Recycling is a pivotal piece of the sustainability picture, helping industries reduce waste, pollution, and energy use while preserving raw materials and cutting costs for consumers. From steel and aluminium to tyres and batteries, the automotive industry is making notable progress in the efficiency of its recycling operations. Recent developments at Shell raise the bar even further with the promise of a more circular economy in the field of vehicle lubricants.
